description.value: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, and the target must succeed on a [[/save con 13 format=long]] or be &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also &Reference[unconscious]{unconscious} while &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

&Reference[fey]{Fey} Ancestry. The drow has advantage on saving throws against being &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, and magic can’t put the drow to sleep.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
Innate Spellcasting. The drow’s spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

At will: dancing lights

1/day each: darkness, faerie &Reference[fire]{fire}

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Sunlight Sensitivity. While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.

macro.name: Dancing Lights

description.value:
Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with &Reference[darkvision]{darkvision} can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

Each object in a 20-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} within range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Any creature in the area when the spell is cast is also outlined in light if it fails a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius.

Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can't benefit from being &Reference[invisible]{invisible}.
